00012 /*
00013  * Dialogue information. A series of these follow after DIAL records,
00014  * and form a linked list of dialogue items.
00015  */
00016 
00017 struct DialInfo
00018 {
00019     enum Gender
00020     {
00021         Male = 0,
00022         Female = 1,
00023         NA = -1
00024     };
00025 
00026     struct DATAstruct
00027     {
00028         int unknown1;
00029         int disposition;
00030         char rank; // Rank of NPC
00031         char gender; // See Gender enum
00032         char PCrank; // Player rank
00033         char unknown2;
00034     }; // 12 bytes
00035     DATAstruct data;
00036 
00037     // The rules for whether or not we will select this dialog item.
00038     struct SelectStruct
00039     {
00040         std::string selectRule; // This has a complicated format
00041         float f; // Only one of 'f' or 'i' is used
00042         int i;
00043         VarType type;
00044     };
00045 
00046     // Journal quest indices (introduced with the quest system in Tribunal)
00047     enum QuestStatus
00048     {
00049         QS_None,
00050         QS_Name,
00051         QS_Finished,
00052         QS_Restart,
00053         QS_Deleted
00054     };
00055 
00056     // Rules for when to include this item in the final list of options
00057     // visible to the player.
00058     std::vector<SelectStruct> selects;
00059 
00060     // Id of this, previous and next INFO items
00061     std::string id, prev, next,
00062 
00063     // Various references used in determining when to select this item.
00064             actor, race, clas, npcFaction, pcFaction, cell,
00065 
00066             // Sound and text associated with this item
00067             sound, response,
00068 
00069             // Result script (uncomiled) to run whenever this dialog item is
00070             // selected
00071             resultScript;
00072 
00073     // ONLY include this item the NPC is not part of any faction.
00074     bool factionLess;
00075 
00076     // Status of this quest item
00077     QuestStatus questStatus;
00078 
00079     // Hexadecimal versions of the various subrecord names.
00080     enum SubNames
00081     {
00082         REC_ONAM = 0x4d414e4f,
00083         REC_RNAM = 0x4d414e52,
00084         REC_CNAM = 0x4d414e43,
00085         REC_FNAM = 0x4d414e46,
00086         REC_ANAM = 0x4d414e41,
00087         REC_DNAM = 0x4d414e44,
00088         REC_SNAM = 0x4d414e53,
00089         REC_NAME = 0x454d414e,
00090         REC_SCVR = 0x52564353,
00091         REC_INTV = 0x56544e49,
00092         REC_FLTV = 0x56544c46,
00093         REC_BNAM = 0x4d414e42,
00094         REC_QSTN = 0x4e545351,
00095         REC_QSTF = 0x46545351,
00096         REC_QSTR = 0x52545351,
00097         REC_DELE = 0x454c4544
00098     };
00099 
00100     void load(ESMReader &esm);
00101 };
00102 
00103 /*
00104   Some old and unused D code and comments, that might be useful later:
00105   --------
00106 
00107   // We only need to put each item in ONE list. For if your NPC
00108   // matches this response, then it must match ALL criteria, thus it
00109   // will have to look up itself in all the lists. I think the order
00110   // is well optimized in making the lists as small as possible.
00111   if(this.actor.index != -1) actorDial[this.actor][parent]++;
00112   else if(cell != "") cellDial[cell][parent]++;
00113   else if(this.Class != -1) classDial[this.Class][parent]++;
00114   else if(this.npcFaction != -1)
00115     factionDial[this.npcFaction][parent]++;
00116   else if(this.race != -1) raceDial[this.race][parent]++;
00117   else allDial[parent]++; // Lists dialogues that might
00118   // apply to all npcs.
00119   */
00120 
00121 // List of dialogue topics (and greetings, voices, etc.) that
00122 // reference other objects. Eg. raceDial is indexed by the indices of
00123 // all races referenced. The value of raceDial is a new AA, which is
00124 // basically used as a map (the int value is just a count and isn't
00125 // used for anything important.) The indices (or elements of the map)
00126 // are the dialogues that reference the given race. I use an AA
00127 // instead of a list or array, since each dialogue can be added lots
00128 // of times.
00129 
00130 /*
00131 int allDial[Dialogue*];
00132 int classDial[int][Dialogue*];
00133 int factionDial[int][Dialogue*];
00134 int actorDial[Item][Dialogue*];
00135 // If I look up cells on cell load, I don't have to resolve these
00136 // names into anything!
00137 int cellDial[char[]][Dialogue*];
00138 int raceDial[int][Dialogue*];
00139 */
00140 }
